intro: Rhodiola namlingensis, commonly known as the Namling rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. This plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to harsh alpine conditions. It is often found growing at elevations above 3,500 meters. Rhodiola namlingensis is valued for its potential adaptogenic properties and is used in traditional medicine.
